meanings.definition: One who recants or retracts a statement or belief.
meanings.sent1: The recanter admitted he was wrong and changed his mind.
meanings.sent2: The journalist turned recanter after new evidence emerged.
meanings.sent3: The recanter sheepishly apologized for his mistake.
meanings.sent4: She was a recanter of gossip, always taking back what she said.
meanings.sent5: The recanter's flip-flopping made it hard to trust his words.

meanings.definition: To retract or disavow a statement or belief.
meanings.sent1: He had to recanter his earlier claim due to new information.
meanings.sent2: She decided to recanter her support for the controversial policy.
meanings.sent3: The politician recantered his promise, causing confusion among voters.
meanings.sent4: The company had to recanter their advertisement after complaints.
meanings.sent5: The student quickly recantered his answer when he realized it was incorrect.
